pattern.name: bug_report
pattern.description: Standard structure for reporting bugs and issues found during QA testing.
pattern.template: <bug_report> <title>Short summary of the issue</title> <environment>Describe the environment (OS, Python version, etc.)</environment> <steps_to_reproduce> <step>Step 1: ...</step> <step>Step 2: ...</step> <step>Step 3: ...</step> </steps_to_reproduce> <expected_behavior>What should happen</expected_behavior> <actual_behavior>What actually happens</actual_behavior> <evidence> <log>Relevant error logs or stack traces</log> <screenshot>Path or link to screenshot if available</screenshot> </evidence> <severity>critical|major|minor|trivial</severity> <possible_cause>Optional: suspected cause</possible_cause> </bug_report>
pattern.explanation: Use this structure to ensure all bug reports are clear, reproducible, and actionable for developers.

pattern.name: test_case
pattern.description: Reusable format for documenting test cases.
pattern.template: <test_case> <id>Unique identifier</id> <description>What this test covers</description> <preconditions>Any setup required before running the test</preconditions> <steps> <step>Step 1: ...</step> <step>Step 2: ...</step> </steps> <expected_result>Expected outcome</expected_result> <actual_result>Actual outcome (filled after execution)</actual_result> <status>pass|fail|blocked</status> </test_case>
pattern.explanation: Use this format to document both manual and automated test cases for traceability.
